Singapore: International Society of the Learning Sciences, pp. 35-43. https://doi.dx.org/10.22318/icls2016.175 Data logged within technology-based learning environments have the potential to support instructors’ orchestration of learner activities. Whereas many learning environments now feature student and teacher dashboards, which promote reflection on activities after the fact, the affordances of displaying these data in real time is only beginning to be explored. To be useful, however, these data must be made accessible and actionable. This interactive demonstration will showcase designs for technologies that visualize student activities in real-time during technology-enhanced activities, with the aim of supporting instructors’ orchestration.
